item.title: Swift - Get random enum
item.description: Function definition func getRandomEnum<T>() -> T? where T: RawRepresentable & CaseIterable && T.RawValue == Int { let max = Int(T.self.allCases.count) let value = Int.random(in: 0...max) return T(rawValue: value) } Usage let country: Countries = getRandomEnum() ?? .france let language: Languages = getRandomEnum() ?? .french Pre-requesite This function will only work for enum that are defined like this: enum Countries: Int, CaseIterable { case france = 0 case unitedKingdom case china case japan } Explanation The function relies on Swift’s generics and type infering to be able to get the correct random enum.
